definition: to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: I can see through my open window the watchman walking up and down.
sentences.chinese: 從開着的窗口，我看得見更夫走來走去。

sentences.english: Geng Fu was born in Changde, Hunan. He currently works at a medical school in the U. S.
sentences.chinese: 更夫，湖南常德人，現在美國某著名醫學院工作。

sentences.english: Watchman and water police have embarked.
Are they civil servants, who shouted to notice people that the weather is day and be careful in candle and fire?
sentences.chinese: 半夜在街上喊天乾物燥小心火燭的更夫，算公務員嗎？

definition: to sound the night watches (on clappers or gongs, in former times)
soldier's copper saucepan, used for cooking food by day and for sounding the night watches during the hours of darkness (in ancient times)
watchman's clapper/wooden clappers with bars of unequal length
forced labor of feudal tenant (corvée)/bailiff of feudal yamen
to patrol at night, marking the time by sounding clappers or gongs
to hold a lamp/to light a lamp
bailiff responsible for catching criminals (in imperial China)
